content: One option is to NOT enter password until you attempt to access account. That gives time to adjust settings. Sync'ing only recent number of days can help and you can also set which folders are NOT to be accessed offline. If the account already exists, another option is to exit thunderbird and, in windows file explorer (assuming windows), delete the folder and it's .msf entry. restart thunderbird and folder will repopulate according to the settings.
creator: davidsk

content: Fai click con il pulsante destro del mouse sulla cartella di Thunderbird chiamata Cartelle locali Nel menù contestuale che si apre scegli Nuova cartella e creati una cartella col nome che preferisci. Ripeti la procedura se ti servono altre cartelle. Puoi spostare le mail in questa cartelle semplicemente trascinandole con il mouse. Se vuoi che Thunderbird lo faccia automaticamente puoi usare i filtri -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/organizzare-messaggi-posta-thundebird-filtri In particolare ti suggerisco di creare un filtro che faccia una copia della posta nelle cartelle che hai creato e non un filtro che sposti direttamente i messaggi.

content: How long did you give it. A whole day is common to rebuild large local stores. I would guess a remote one might take a week. Depending on the upload and download speeds available as the entire contents of each folder will need to be downloaded to index it. It might not be stored, but it is having to arrive so the sorftware can work with it.

content:
The site uses the user agent information supplied by your browser to identify your operating system. It is shown in the Question details on the right of the question page. In your case this is 

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:126.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/126.0

The "a Google Window headed "Sign in to Mozilla Thunderbird Email" which refuses to go away" will be a google oauth authentication request. Your token is obviously expired. As you have not attended to your authentication request you are not being authenticated and are not able to access the account.

Complete the oauth request if you want it to work again is what I am saying.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Solved it for the moment by using an owncloud provided by my company. Would be good to have SFTP though to be able to use the partner company's server.
creator: bauer.klaus.dieter

content:
You are aware this SFTP is 27 years old now and is simply a somewhat more secure version of FTP which is largely obsolete on the internet of today. Mozilla decommissioned their FTP server several years ago and basically said the protocol was so close to dead it was not worth the effort.

There have been many filelink providers over the years https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/search/?q=filelionk&appver=&platform= if you think Kiteworks should support it, I suggest you ask them to author the addon required to implement their API.

But I am a little concerned about using public links (and that is what a filelink URL is) with restricted data. You would be much better served using SMIME or PGP encrypted email messages with the data stored on a secure server. At least with encrypted email you could use public URL's.
creator: MattAuSupport

creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Perhaps ask Microsoft how to import your data. I have no idea what tools they provide (probably none) but seriously there is no formalized task format, so I doubt you can do anything with them.

Calendars are generally managed using iCAL files, and Thunderbird exports them. What Microsoft does with them is again something you need to address with them.

Thunderbird will export your contacts as a CSV file (one per address book) and I know outlook used to import that. I have no idea what Office 365 does. I assume it also supports them

I see not reason for an MBOX to PST tool however as Thunderbird only stores mail in an MBOX formatted file and you say you have already moved that.

But all of that migration stuff depends on where and how your data exists not. My contacts in Thunderbird are synced with google for instance, so I would not be importing them from Thunderbird. Likewise my calendars are on caldav server on the internet (Google Yahoo and GMX). Microsoft however uses a proprietary calendar solution, so If you have remote calendars you will need to ask Microsoft how you import using their proprietary solution.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
The release notes for Thunderbird 78 state Mac: macOS 10.9 or later https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/78.0/releasenotes/

So you are right on that part.

Just install the DMG, it should simply pick up you existing profile and load it. But be sure to install IIRC versions of DMG's that old would simply run in the system temp folder without explicit installation and folk complained that every time they restarted the computer their settings and mail were gone.
